text:
Subject: Advisory on Convention Violation

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to advise on the recent incident involving a Spanish vessel and Belgian authorized officers under the Convention on Conduct of Fishing Operations in the North Atlantic.

On the date in question, Belgian authorized officers observed unmarked lines anchored in the sea, potentially in violation of Article 5 and Annex IV of the Convention. When the officers approached a Spanish vessel to seek information, the Spanish officers on board refused to cooperate.

Under Article 9(5) of the Convention, authorized officers have the power to seek information from vessels. Furthermore, Article 9(10) states that resistance by a vessel to the directions of an authorized officer shall be deemed as resistance to the authority of the flag State of that vessel.

Given that Spain's reservation to Article 9(5) and (6) does not apply to Belgium, as Belgium has not made a reservation against Spain under Article 14(3), these provisions are binding between Belgium and Spain.

Therefore, the review board is likely to decide that the Spanish vessel's refusal to cooperate with the Belgian authorized officers constitutes a violation of the Convention under Article 9(10).

We advise that Spain consider this interpretation when preparing its response to the review board.

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
```
